bill_title: To ensure the existence of a healthy, sustainable equine population.

bill_versions.bill_text: A RESOLUTION, to ensure the existence of a healthy, sustainable equine population. WHEREAS, South Dakota has high respect and appreciation for the horse in the American landscape, and is mindful of the contribution of horses to the economy, history, and character of the United States; and WHEREAS, the horse deserves protection, compassion, and humane treatment during ownership, transport, sale, and processing; and WHEREAS, more than 100,000 horses are harvested annually in the United States for consumption in foreign markets or for domestic by-product use as a responsible means of maintaining a healthy, sustainable horse population; NOW, THEREFORE, BE IT RESOLVED, by the House of the Ninety-Fifth Legislature of the State of South Dakota, that it supports legislation that allows for the sale, possession, and transport of horses intended for processing; domestic ownership; contract and location of equine processing facilities; and the funding for Food Safety and Inspection Service inspectors in facilities, including facilities on South Dakota Indian lands, that humanely reduce equine populations; BE IT FURTHER RESOLVED, that the House opposes the passage of the Horse Slaughter Prevention Act and any legislation or regulation that prohibits the humane harvest of equines.

A RESOLUTION, To ensure the existence of a healthy, sustainable equine population. WHEREAS, South Dakota has high respect and appreciation for the horse in the American landscape, and is mindful of the contribution of horses to the economy, history, and character of the United States; and WHEREAS, the horse deserves protection, compassion, and humane treatment during ownership, transport, sale, and processing; and WHEREAS, more than 100,000 horses are harvested annually in the United States for consumption in foreign markets or for domestic by-product use as a responsible means of maintaining a healthy, sustainable horse population; NOW, THEREFORE, BE IT RESOLVED, by the House of the Ninety-Fifth Legislature of the State of South Dakota, that it supports legislation that allows for the sale, possession, and transport of horses intended for processing; domestic ownership; contract and location of equine processing facilities; and the funding for Food Safety and Inspection Service inspectors in facilities, including facilities on South Dakota Indian lands, that humanely reduce equine populations; BE IT FURTHER RESOLVED, that the House opposes the passage of the Horse Slaughter Prevention Act and any legislation or regulation that prohibits the humane harvest of equines. Adopted by the House of Representatives, February 19, 2020 _____________________ _____________________ Steven G. Haugaard Mary Lou Goehring Speaker of the House Chief Clerk
